# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Certainly! You can use the following Julia function to achieve this:

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df.ym = df.dt .|> x -> year(x)*100 + month(x)
    return df
end
```

This function adds a new column `ym` to the DataFrame `df` by taking the `dt` column, extracting the year and month from each date using the `year()` and `month()` functions from the `Dates` module respectively, then concatenating them as an integer in the specified format. The `.|>` operator is used to broadcast the transformation across all elements of the `dt` column.
